Address.college_name: Pontifical Ambrosian Institute of Sacred Music
Address.university_name: Pontificio Istituto Ambrosiano di Musica Sacra (PIAMS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1931 by cardinal A.I. Schuster, Archbishop of Milan. Earned current status in 1940
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to July (October - February; February - July)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1887 and began academic activity in 1890. Acquired present status as pontifical university in 2005
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1954 in Turin (Italy) as the International Higher Institute of Pedagogy and Religious studies in Turin. Was incorporated into the Higher Institute of Pedagogy at the Salesian Pontifical University in Rome in 1966. Acquired present status in 1970
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Divisions.College: Center for Studies on Salesian Sisters

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1551 as 'Collegium Romanum' by Ignatius of Loyola and Francis Borgia. Constituted as University by Pope Julius III, 1553. The Institution developed considerably under Pope Gregory XIII, who is considered to be 'founder and father' of the University which now bears his name. Depends directly on the Holy See and administration is entrusted to the Society of Jesus. The Grand Chancellor is the Cardinal Prefect of the Congregation of Studies and the Vice-Grand Chancellor the Superior-General of the Society of Jesus. Juridical recognition is granted to the University by the government of Italy. Incorporated the Pontificio Istituto Biblico and Pontificio Istituto Orientale March 2024
AdmissionRequirements: Completed classical secondary education and, where necessary, additional preparatory studies to meet Faculty requirements

Divisions.College: Cardinal Bae Center for Judaic Studies
Center for Formators to the Priesthood and Religious Life
History and Cultural Heritage of the Church

Address.college_name: Pontifical Gregorian University – Pontifical Biblical Institute
Address.university_name: Pontificia Università Gregoriana – Pontificio Istituto Biblico (PIB)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1909 by Pope Pius X. Orientalistic faculty erected in 1932 with privilege to confer licentiate and doctorate degrees. Acquired present status in 1985. Incorporated to the Pontificia Università Gregoriana March 2024
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to June (October - February; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Address.college_name: Pontifical Gregorian University – Oriental Pontifical Institute
Address.university_name: Pontificia Università Gregoriana – Pontificio Istituto Orientale (PIO)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1917 following the establishment of the Congregation for the Eastern Churches. Incorporated to the Pontificia Università Gregoriana (IAU-013676) March 2024
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to June (October - February; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Completed classical secondary education and, where necessary, additional preparatory studies to meet Faculty requirements

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in Motu Proprio in 2017. Earned approval from the Congregation for Catholic Education in 2019
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to June (October - January; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Address.college_name: Pontifical Institute of Arab and Islamic Studies
Address.university_name: Pontificio Istituto di Studi Arabi e d’Islamistica (PISAI)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1926 in Tunis. Moved to Rome 1964. Acquired present title and status 1979
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1925 by a Motu Propio of Pope Pius XI as a research centre
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1910 as Scuola Superiore di Musica Sacra. Earned Pontifical title and faculty to confer academic degrees in 1914. Acquired present status 1931
AdmissionRequirements: Entrance exam required for admission to Baccalaureate program

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1773 by Pope Clement XIV as "Collegio Romano". Moved to the Lateran hill 1937 and became Pontificio Ateneo Lateranense and Pontificia Universitas Lateranensis 1959. Directly dependent on the Holy See, legally established in the Vatican City State. Under the jurisdiction of the Congregation for Catholic Education
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or high school graduation certificate (level of study required for access to university in student's home country)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1927
Erected in 1687 and restored to present status in 1887. Faculty of canon law suspended in 1928
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Address.college_name: Pontifical University of St. Thomas Aquinas
Address.university_name: Pontificia Università S. Tommaso d'Aquino Angelicum (PUST)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1577 as College of St. Thomas for students of the Dominican Order. Faculty of Philosophy added 1882 by Apostolic Decree of Pope Leo XIII, Faculty of Canon Law added 1896. Became Pontifical University 1906. Acquired present title 1963
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Address.college_name: Pontifical University of the Holy Cross

GeneralInformation.History: Established as the Roman Academic Center of the Holy Cross in 1984. Current title and approval earned by the Congregation for Catholic Education in 1998
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to June (October - January; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Established in 1993 by the Congregation for Catholic Education. Title granted by Pope John Paul II in 1998. Faculty of Bioethics approved in 2001. Acquired canonical status in 2004
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Divisions.College: Institute for Higher Studies on Women

GeneralInformation.History: Founded by Pope Gregory XV in 1622 for the formation of missionaries. Earned title as Pontifical College in 1627. Earned current rank and title in 1962
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Address.university_name: Università Pontificia Salesiana – Pontificia Studiorium Universitas Salesiana (UPS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1904 as institute, became athenaeum 1940 and University 1973. Under the jurisdiction of the Congregation for Catholic Education and of the Salesian Order.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 2008 as a reseach and study center in the Abba school of philosophy
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to August (September - November; November - January; February - March; April - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award

Divisions.College: Department of Social and Political Sciences, Economics and Management
Department of Theology, Philosophy, and Human Sciences

Address.college_name: The Faculty of Canon Law Saint Pius X Venice
Address.university_name: Facoltà di Diritto Canonico S. Pio X di Venezia

GeneralInformation.History: Found in 1902 as the Institute of Canon Law at the Patriarchal Seminary in Venice under Patriarch Cardinal Giussepe Sarto. Earned current status in 2003
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate acceptable for University admission in the country of award
